abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Third Flood Control and
            Drainage Project for Bangladesh were as follows: borrower
            performance is also regarded as unsatisfactory. Works that
            were intended to be completed in four years took eight years
            to complete. O&M of completed works had not been
            initiated by project completion, and work required for
            sustainability is only now being started. IDA performance
            must also be regarded as unsatisfactory. The project as
            designed at appraisal included some components which had to
            be dropped later as uneconomic. Some lessons learned
            included: land acquisition compensations should be based on
            land value market studies and the land acquisition system
            itself ought to be carefully planned and the bureaucratic
            process streamlined before  project negotiations or credit
            effectiveness; board presentation prior to detailed
            engineering investigation and design increases the risk of
            need to modify project components and of pre-construction
            delays; and timely preparation of an appropriate O&M
            plan and adequate funding for its implementation are
            essential to ensure sustainability of project-supported investment.
